SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SYNC MANAGEMENT
Sync Management App

Use the Sync Management app to monitor sync, view and modify sync configuration settings, and configure mobile settings. You can also manage mobile deployment packages and mobile themes, configure sync messages, and customize tracked objects, named fetch trees, and named queries.

Device Health Summary
The Device Health Summary page shows the Monitor Device Health Dashboard. The dashboard shows the details of the mobile devices running the CG Cloud offline mobile app.
Device Health Details
The Device Health Details page shows the details of all the sync processes you can run in the Monitor Device Detailed Health Dashboard.
Device Status Overview
The Device Status Overview page shows the mobile devices running the Consumer Goods Cloud offline mobile application, and detailed information about those devices.
Sync History
The Sync History page shows information about sync attempts, sync duration, sync type, user information, sync status, and all sync-related data that is uploaded and downloaded.
Device Events Log
The Device Events Log page shows log messages from the mobile devices and detailed information about query executions and affected records within the APEX endpoints of Consumer Goods Cloud Synchronization. The page uses the Device Events Log object to show information.
Sync Configuration
Use the Sync Configuration tab to configure and monitor the Consumer Goods Cloud offline mobile app. You can configure tracked objects, named fetch trees, named queries, mobile settings and sync settings.
Sync Messages
During the initial sync, application start, and First Sync of the Day (FSOD), the Consumer Goods (CG) Cloud offline mobile app shows a sync progress page. To keep users engaged during the sync progress, configure sync messages in the sync progress page. You can also translate labels and feedback messages shown in CG Cloud offline mobile app in supported languages.
Deployment Packages
Customize the Consumer Goods Cloud Offline Mobile app by using Consumer Goods Cloud Modeler. Use deployment packages to expedite the deployment of customizations to the app users of your org by uploading your customizations in a zipped deployment file.
Mobile App Themes
Customize the color of the UI components, such as add a checkbox or a call calendar, by using the Mobility Themes tab of the Sync Management app. You can modify the default image icons by changing the theming .zip files used by the mobile app. After you activate the changes to a mobile theme in the Sync Management app, the changes are transferred to the mobile application when the application starts. A sales rep can then choose one of the available mobile themes for the mobile application.
Remote Request
Identify issues by requesting and analyzing extended mobile app sync data or logs by triggering remote requests for mobile devices.
